item.title: MongoDB
item.description: Document MongoDB stores data records as BSON documents. Document Structure MongoDB documents are composed of field-and-value pairs and have the following structure. The field name s are strings, and the value of a field can be any of the BSON data types . json { field1: value1, field2: value2, field3: value3, ... fieldN: valueN } + Indexes Indexes is the key for efficient read queries. Without indexes, MongoDB must perform a collection scan (scan every document in a collection) to find those documents that match the query statement.
